intro: Koenigia nepalensis var. nepalensis, commonly known as the Himalayan rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky and mountainous environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a raceme. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
